item.title: Is it reasonable to expect consumers to be fluent in foreign languages? This was the question addressed by the CJEU in the Golden Balls case.
item.description:
Anna Dannreuther, Trainee, Research Department of the CJEU (All views author’s own) The Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) issued a judgment on November 20th in the case of Intra-Presse SAS v OHIM (the ‘Golden Balls’ case), which did not resolve the seven-year trademark dispute between the UK company Golden Balls Ltd. and Intra-Presse, the French organizers of FIFA’s Ballon d’Or award. The case revolves around the registration of the word mark ‘Golden Balls’...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-it-reasonable-to-expect-consumers-to-be-fluent-in-foreign-languages-this-was-the-question-addressed-by-the-cjeu-in-the-golden-balls-case/
